content.question: In the <math alttext="x y"><mi>x</mi><mi>y</mi></math>-plane, the position of a particle at time <math alttext="t"><mi>t</mi></math> is given by the parametric function <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> defined by <math alttext="f open parentheses t close parentheses equals open parentheses x open parentheses t close parentheses comma y open parentheses t close parentheses close parentheses"><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mfenced><mrow><mi>x</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>,</mo><mi>y</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced></mrow></mfenced></math> for <math alttext="negative 10 less or equal than t less or equal than 10"><mo>-</mo><mn>10</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>10</mn></math> seconds. If <math alttext="x open parentheses t close parentheses equals 4 t minus 7"><mi>x</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn><mi>t</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>7</mn></math> and <math alttext="y open parentheses t close parentheses equals 1 minus t squared"><mi>y</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>-</mo><msup><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></math>, at what time <math alttext="t"><mi>t</mi></math> is the particle farthest up in the <math alttext="x y"><mi>x</mi><mi>y</mi></math>-plane?

unit.text: 4: Functions Involving Parameters, Vectors, and Matrices (Not assessed on the AP Exam)

skill.text: Skill 3.B: Apply numerical results in a given mathematical or applied context.
